page.title: 18Training Centre, Montrose.
page.content: In Montrose,the{Adult Training Centre for the{mentally handicapped}is on the edge of the Industrial Estate.It opened in{1976}and has classrooms as well as workshops.Lessons in language and maths are of infant standard but visits to shows and places of interest give the trainees a broader base to their education.Trainees make toys for playgroups,trays,rabbit hutches,etc.as well as learning to look after themselves.In the greenhouse they grow tomato and bedding plants.Alongside,is the site for a new swimming pool to cost Â£23,000.Much of this money has been raised by the collection and sale of aluminium cans.To keep healthy the trainees use exercise cycles, a treadmill as well as taking part in sports,jogging and even marathon running!About 40 adults from Montrose, Edzell and Brechin areas attend daily.
